title: Why Polls Missed A Shocker In Virginia’s Senate Race FiveThirtyEight » Nate Silver | FiveThirtyEight

type_specific.selection: Projections from early exit polls have a well-deserved reputation for being dubious — just ask President John Kerry. But early Tuesday evening, they suggested a potentially shocking outcome in Virginia. Ed Gillespie, the Republican U.S. Senate candidate, was in an extremely close race against Democratic incumbent Mark Warner, who had led by about 9 percentage […]
